jx.jx_en_mean: an economic situation in which goods or shares are plentiful and buyers can keep prices down
jx.jx_cn_mean: 买方市场（指货物或股票充足，买方可以压价的经济状态）

entry.def: A buyer is a person who is buying something or who intends to buy it.

example.ex: Car buyers are more interested in safety and reliability than speed.
example.tran: 购车者们更感兴趣的是汽车的安全性和可靠性，而不是它的速度。

entry.tran: （大商店的）采购员，进货员；买手
entry.def: A buyer is a person who works for a large store deciding what goods will be bought from manufacturers to be sold in the store.

example.ex: I was a buyer for the women's clothing department.

Sentence.sentence: A house with a fireplace has a stronger appeal to buyers.
W : We mainly deal with large volume buyers from western countries and our products have been well received.

sentences.en: The buyer was convinced of the salesman’s integrity.
The buyer missed the boat and never got the house when he offered too low a bid.

sentences.en: He demanded payment of the buyer.

means.word_mean: 买方市场(指供过于求的状况)

sentences.en: We got a very good deal on our new car— it really is a buyer’s market at the moment.
sentences.cn: 我们的新车买得很合算—眼下确实是买方市场。
